mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics module¶

mavDynamics

  • this file implements the dynamic equations of motion for MAV

  • use unit quaternion for the attitude state

mavsim_python

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Update history:

    2/24/2020 - RWB

class mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.GpsTransient(nu_n: float, nu_e: float, nu_h: float)¶

Bases: object

Struct for storing the gps transient (represent a Guass-Markov process)

n¶

Transient in the north direction

e¶

Transient in the east direction

h¶

Transient in the altitude

print() → None¶

Print the commands to the console

to_array() → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Convert the command to a numpy array.

class mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.MavDynamics(Ts: float, state: DynamicState | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Implements the dynamics of the MAV using vehicle inputs and wind

external_set_state(new_state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → None¶

Loads a new state

get_state() → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Returns the state

sensors(noise_scale: float = 1.0) → MsgSensors¶

Return the values of the sensors given the current state. Note that GPS is only updated periodically according to the period SENSOR.ts_gps

Parameters:

noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

Returns:

The resulting sensor readings

Return type:

sensors

update(delta: MsgDelta, wind: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → None¶

Integrate the differential equations defining dynamics, update sensors

Parameters:

  • delta – (delta_a, delta_e, delta_r, delta_t) are the control inputs

  • wind – the wind vector in inertial coordinates

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.accelerometer(phi: float, theta: float, forces: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], noise_scale: float, accel_sigma: float = 0.024525) → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Calculates the accelerometer measurement based upon the current state data

Parameters:

  • phi – roll angle

  • theta – pitch angle

  • forces – 3x1 forces vector acting on UAV (in body frame)

  • noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

  • accel_sigma – The standard deviation of the accelerometer

Returns:

body frame x-y-z acceleration measurements

Return type:

accel_x, accel_y, accel_z

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.calculate_sensor_readings(state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], forces: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], nu: GpsTransient, Va: float, sensors_prev: MsgSensors, update_gps: bool, noise_scale: float = 1.0) → tuple[MsgSensors, GpsTransient]¶

Calculates the sensor readings. This involves calculating the sensor data without noise and then adding in the noise.

Sensor values: gyros, accelerometers, absolute_pressure, dynamic_pressure

and GPS

Parameters:

  • state – current state of the aircraft

  • forces – 3x1 forces vector acting on UAV (in body frame)

  • nu – Latest GPS transients

  • Va – airspeed

  • sensors_prev – previous readings of the sensors

  • update_gps – true - update the gps sensor, false - use the previous gps reading

  • noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

Returns:

The resulting sensor readings nu_update: The updated gps transients

Return type:

sensors

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.gps(position: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], V_g_b: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], e_quat: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], nu: GpsTransient, noise_scale: float = 1.0, gps_Vg_sigma: float = 0.005, gps_course_sigma: float = 0.00025) → tuple[float, float, float, float, float]¶

Calculates the transient update of the gps error which is based upon a Gauss-Markov process

Parameters:

  • position – 3x1 vector of position (north, east, down)

  • V_g_b – 3x1 vector of velocities in body frame

  • e_quat – 4x1 vector consisting of the quaternion (e0, ex, ey, ez)

  • nu – the current value of transient error

  • noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

  • gps_Vg_sigma – Standard deviation of the ground velocity measurement

  • gps_course_sigma – Standard deviation of the course angle measurement

Returns:

(n,e,-d) measurement of position gps_Vg: Ground velocity measurement from GPS gps_course: GPS measurement of course angle

Return type:

(gps_n, gps_e, gps_h)

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.gps_error_trans_update(nu: GpsTransient, noise_scale: float = 1.0, gps_k: float = 0.0009090909090909091, ts_gps: float = 0.2, gps_n_sigma: float = 0.05, gps_e_sigma: float = 0.05, gps_h_sigma: float = 0.15) → GpsTransient¶

Calculates the transient update of the gps error which is based upon a Gauss-Markov process

Parameters:

  • nu – the previous value of the transient error

  • noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

  • gps_k – 1 / s - time constant of the process

  • ts_gps – period of the gps measurement

  • gps_n_sigma – Standard deviation of the north gps measurement

  • gps_e_sigma – Standard deviation of the east gps measurement

  • gps_h_sigma – Standard deviation of the altitude gps measurement

Returns:

Updated GPS transient

Return type:

nu

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.gyro(p: float, q: float, r: float, noise_scale: float = 1.0, gyro_sigma: float = np.float64(0.0022689280275926286), gyro_x_bias: float = 0.0, gyro_y_bias: float = 0.0, gyro_z_bias: float = 0.0) → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Calculates the gyro measurement based upon the current state data

Parameters:

  • (p – body x-y-z roll rates (rad/sec)

  • q – body x-y-z roll rates (rad/sec)

  • r) – body x-y-z roll rates (rad/sec)

  • noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

  • gyro_sigma – Standard deviation of the gyro

  • gyro_x_bias – bias in the body x direction

  • gyro_y_bias – bias in the body y direction

  • gyro_z_bias – bias in the body z direction

Returns:

body frame x-y-z gyro measurements

Return type:

gyro_x, gyro_y, gyro_z

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.magnetometer(quat_b_to_i: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], noise_scale: float = 1.0, mag_inc: float = np.float64(-1.1519173063162575), mag_dec: float = np.float64(0.2181661564992912), mag_sigma: float = np.float64(0.0005235987755982988)) → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Calculates the magnetometer measurement based upon the current state. The resulting output is a magnetometer reading in the body frame with additive noise. Note that this is not in the book

Args:

quat_b_to_i: body to inertial quaternion noise_scale: Scaling on the random white noise mag_inc: Inclination of the magnetic to inertial frame mag_dec: Declination of the magnetic to inertial frame mag_sigma: Standard deviation of the magnetic sensor measurement

Returns:

mag_x, mag_y, mag_z: body frame x-y-z magnetometer measurements

mav_sim.chap7.mav_dynamics.pressure(down: float, Va: float, noise_scale: float = 1.0, abs_pres_bias: float = 0.0, abs_pres_sigma: float = 10.0, diff_pres_bias: float = 0.0, diff_pres_sigma: float = 2.0) → tuple[float, float]¶

Calculates the pressure sensor measurement based upon the current state data

Parameters:

  • down – down position

  • Va – airspeed

  • noise_scale – Scaling on the random white noise

  • abs_pres_bias – bias in the absolute pressure measurement

  • abs_pres_sigma – standard deviation in the absolute pressure measurement

  • diff_pres_bias – bias in the differential pressure measurement

  • diff_pres_sigma – standard deviation in the differential pressure measurement

Returns:

Absolute pressure measurement diff_pressure: Differential pressure measurement

Return type:

abs_pressure
